hadiths.text: It was narrated from 'Umar that:When the prohibition of Khamr was revealed, 'Umar said: "O Allah, give us a clear ruling on Khamr," and the Verse in Al-Baqarah was revealed. 'Umar was called and it was recited to him. Then 'Umar said: "O Allah, give us a clear ruling on Khamr," and the Verse in An-Nisa' was revealed: "O you who believe! Approach not As-Salah (the prayer) when you are in a drunken state". And when the Iqamah for prayer was said, the caller of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] would cry out: "O you who believe! Approach not As-Salah (the prayer) when you are in a drunken state." 'Umar was called and this was recited to him. Then he said: "O Allah, give us a clear ruling on Khamr." Then the Verse in Surat Al-Ma'idah was revealed, and 'Umar was called, and it was recited to him. When he reached the words, "So, will you not then abstain?," 'Umar said: "We have abstained, we have abstained

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْخَمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Khamr

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik said:"While I was taking care of a group of people, including my paternal uncles, and I was the youngest of them, a man came and said: 'Khamr has been forbidden.' I was taking care of them, and was pouring Fadikh (date-wine) for them. They said: 'Pour it away.' So I poured it away." I (the narrator) said to Anas: "What is that?" He said: "Unripe dates and dried dates." Abu Bakr bin Anas said: "That was their wine in those days." And Anas did not deny that

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ الشَّرَابِ الَّذِي أُهْرِيقَ بِتَحْرِيمِ الْخَمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: The Drinks Which Were Destroyed When Khamr Was Prohibited

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Anas said:"I was pouring (wine) for Abu Talhah, Ubayy bin Ka'b and Abu Dujanah among a group of Ansar when a man came in and said: 'Something new has happened; the prohibition of Khamr has been revealed.' So we poured it away." He said: "The only intoxicant in those days was Fadikh, a mixture of unripe dates and dried dates." And Anas said: "Khamr was forbidden, and most of their Khamr in those days was Fadikh

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ الشَّرَابِ الَّذِي أُهْرِيقَ بِتَحْرِيمِ الْخَمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: The Drinks Which Were Destroyed When Khamr Was Prohibited

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:"When Khamr was forbidden, their drink was (made from) unripe dates and dried dates

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ الشَّرَابِ الَّذِي أُهْرِيقَ بِتَحْرِيمِ الْخَمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: The Drinks Which Were Destroyed When Khamr Was Prohibited

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Jabir - meaning bin 'Abdullah - said:"Unripe dates and dried dates are Khamr

chapter.ara-name: باب اسْتِحْقَاقِ الْخَمْرِ لِشَرَابِ الْبُسْرِ وَالتَّمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Khamr is a Drink (Made) of Unripe Dates and Dried Dates

hadiths.text: Jabir bin 'Abdullah said:"Unripe dates and dried dates are Khamr." Al-A'mash narrated it in Marfu' form

chapter.ara-name: باب اسْتِحْقَاقِ الْخَمْرِ لِشَرَابِ الْبُسْرِ وَالتَّمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Khamr is a Drink (Made) of Unripe Dates and Dried Dates

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Jabir that:The Prophet [SAW] said: "Raisins and dried dates are Khamr

chapter.ara-name: باب اسْتِحْقَاقِ الْخَمْرِ لِشَرَابِ الْبُسْرِ وَالتَّمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Khamr is a Drink (Made) of Unripe Dates and Dried Dates

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Ibn Abi Laila, from one of the Companions of the Prophet [SAW], that:The Prophet [SAW] forbade (mixtures of) Al-Balh and dried dates, and of raisins and dried dates

chapter.ara-name: باب نَهْىِ الْبَيَانِ عَنْ شُرْبِ، نَبِيذِ الْخَلِيطَيْنِ الرَّاجِعَةِ إِلَى بَيَانِ الْبَلَحِ وَالتَّمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Clear Prohibition of Drinking Nabidh Made of Two Things Mixed Together, Relies Upon the C

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba', Al-Hantam, Al-Muzaffat, and An-Naqir, and (he forbade) mixing Al-Balh with Az-Zahuw

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبَلَحِ وَالزَّهْوِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Balh and Az-Zahuw

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba', Al-Muzaffat," - and on one occasion he added: "An-Naqir," - "and (he forbade) mixing At-Tamr (dried dates) with raisins, and Az-Zahuw with At-Tamr

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبَلَحِ وَالزَّهْوِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Balh and Az-Zahuw

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade (mixing) Az-Zahuw and At-Tamr, and raisins and dried dates (At-Tamr)

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبَلَحِ وَالزَّهْوِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Balh and Az-Zahuw

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Abi Qatadah narrated from his father that:The Prophet [SAW] said: "Do not combine dried dates with raisins, nor Az-Zahuw with ripe dates

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الزَّهْوِ وَالرُّطَبِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Az-Zahuw and Rutab Ripe Dates

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Abu Qatadah that:The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Do not soak Az-Zahuw and ripe dates together, and do not soak raisins and ripe dates together

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الزَّهْوِ وَالرُّطَبِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Az-Zahuw and Rutab Ripe Dates

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade mixing dried dates and raisins, and mixing Az-Zahuw and dried dates, and Az-Zahuw and Al-Busr

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الزَّهْوِ وَالْبُسْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Az-Zahuw and Al-Busr

hadiths.text: Ata' narrated from Jabir that:The Prophet [SAW] forbade mixing dried dates and raisins, and Al-Busr and ripe dates

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبُسْرِ وَالرُّطَبِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Busr and Ripe Dates (Ar-Rutab)

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Jabir, that :The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Do not mix raisins and dried dates, nor Al-Busr and dried dates

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبُسْرِ وَالرُّطَبِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Busr and Ripe Dates (Ar-Rutab)

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Jabir that:The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade soaking raisins and dried dates together, and he forbade soaking Al-Busr and dried dates together

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبُسْرِ وَالتَّمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Busr and Dried Dates (At-Tamr)

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba', Al-Hantam, Al-Muzaffat, and An-Naqir, and that Al-Busr be mixed with dried dates, and that raisins be mixed with dried dates, and he wrote to the people of Hajar saying: 'Do not mix raisins and dried dates together

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبُسْرِ وَالتَّمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Busr and Dried Dates (At-Tamr)

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas said:"Al-Busr on their own are unlawful and with dried dates they are unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبُسْرِ وَالتَّمْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Busr and Dried Dates (At-Tamr)

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade mixing dried dates and raisins, and dried dates and Al-Busr

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ التَّمْرِ وَالزَّبِيبِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Dried Dates and Raisins

hadiths.text: Jabir bin 'Abdullah said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade dried dates and raisins, and he forbade dried dates and Al-Busr, if they are soaked together

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ التَّمْرِ وَالزَّبِيبِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Dried Dates and Raisins

hadiths.text: It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatadah, from his father, that:The Prophet [SAW] said: "Do not soak Az-Zahuw and ripe dates, and do not soak ripe dates and raisins together

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الرُّطَبِ وَالزَّبِيبِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Ripe Dates and Raisins

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Jabir that :The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade soaking raisins and Al-Busr together, and he forbade soaking Al-Busr and ripe dates together

chapter.ara-name: باب خَلِيطِ الْبُسْرِ وَالزَّبِيبِ
chapter.eng-name: Mixing Al-Busr and Raisins

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade us to soak two things together when one is more potent than the other. I asked him about Fadikh (a drink made from fresh dates cut open) and he forbade it. He disliked the extra bit on Al-Busr, fearing that that might make it two things, so we used to cut it off

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ الْعِلَّةِ الَّتِي مِنْ أَجْلِهَا نَهَى عَنِ الْخَلِيطَيْنِ وَهِيَ لِيَقْوَى أَحَدُهُمَا عَلَى صَاحِبِهِ
chapter.eng-name: Mentioning the Reason Why These Mixtures are Forbidden, Which is That One of Them is Mor

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Idris said:"I saw Anas bin Malik when some Busr which had extra bits were brought to him, and he started to cut them off

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ الْعِلَّةِ الَّتِي مِنْ أَجْلِهَا نَهَى عَنِ الْخَلِيطَيْنِ وَهِيَ لِيَقْوَى أَحَدُهُمَا عَلَى صَاحِبِهِ
chapter.eng-name: Mentioning the Reason Why These Mixtures are Forbidden, Which is That One of Them is Mor

hadiths.text: Qatadah said:"Anas used to tell us to cut off the extra bits

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ الْعِلَّةِ الَّتِي مِنْ أَجْلِهَا نَهَى عَنِ الْخَلِيطَيْنِ وَهِيَ لِيَقْوَى أَحَدُهُمَا عَلَى صَاحِبِهِ
chapter.eng-name: Mentioning the Reason Why These Mixtures are Forbidden, Which is That One of Them is Mor

hadiths.text: It was narrated that :Anas would not leave any dates that had become ripe but he would remove them from his Fadikh

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ الْعِلَّةِ الَّتِي مِنْ أَجْلِهَا نَهَى عَنِ الْخَلِيطَيْنِ وَهِيَ لِيَقْوَى أَحَدُهُمَا عَلَى صَاحِبِهِ
chapter.eng-name: Mentioning the Reason Why These Mixtures are Forbidden, Which is That One of Them is Mor

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Abu Qatadah that:The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Do not soak Az-Zahuw and ripe dates together, nor Al-Busr and raisins together. Soak each one of them on its own

chapter.ara-name: باب التَّرَخُّصِ فِي انْتِبَاذِ الْبُسْرِ وَحْدَهُ وَشُرْبِهِ قَبْلَ تَغَيُّرِهِ فِي فَضِيخِهِ .
chapter.eng-name: Concession Allowing Soaking of Al-Busr on Their Own, and Drinking it Before it Changes i

hadiths.text: Yahya narrated that 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatadah said to him from his father, that:The Prophet [SAW] forbade mixing Az-Zahuw and dried dates, and mixing Al-Busr and dried dates, and he said: "Soak each one of them on its own in vessels that are tied shut

chapter.ara-name: باب الرُّخْصَةِ فِي الاِنْتِبَاذِ فِي الأَسْقِيَةِ الَّتِي يُلاَثُ عَلَى أَفْوَاهِهَا
chapter.eng-name: Concession Allowing Soaking (Of These Fruits) in Vessels That are Tied Shut

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade mixing Al-Busr with dried dates, or raisins with dried dates, or raisins with Al-Busr, and he said: 'Whoever among you (wants to) drink them, let him drink each one of them on its own: dried dates on their own, or Al-Busr on their own, or raisins on their own

chapter.ara-name: باب التَّرَخُّصِ فِي انْتِبَاذِ التَّمْرِ وَحْدَهُ
chapter.eng-name: Concession Allowing Soaking of Dried Dates on Their Own

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated that:The Prophet [SAW] forbade mixing Al-Busr with dried dates, or raisins with dried dates, or raisins with Al-Busr, and he said: "Whoever among you (wants to) drink them, let him drink each one on its own

chapter.ara-name: باب التَّرَخُّصِ فِي انْتِبَاذِ التَّمْرِ وَحْدَهُ
chapter.eng-name: Concession Allowing Soaking of Dried Dates on Their Own

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade mixing Al-Busr and raisins, and Al-Busr and dried dates, and he said: 'Soak each one of them on its own

chapter.ara-name: باب انْتِبَاذِ الزَّبِيبِ وَحْدَهُ
chapter.eng-name: Soaking Raisins on Their Own

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri that:The Prophet [SAW] forbade soaking dried dates and raisins, and dried dates and Al-Busr, and he said: "Soak raisins on their own, and dried dates on their own, and Al-Busr on their own

chapter.ara-name: باب الرُّخْصَةِ فِي انْتِبَاذِ الْبُسْرِ وَحْدَهُ
chapter.eng-name: Concession Allowing Soaking Al-Busr on Their Own

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Khamr comes from these two.'" Suwaid (one of the narrators) said: "From these two trees: The date palm and the grapevine

chapter.ara-name: باب تَأْوِيلِ قَوْلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى { وَمِنْ ثَمَرَاتِ النَّخِيلِ وَالأَعْنَابِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا }
chapter.eng-name: Interpretation of the Saying of Allah the Most High: "And From the Fruits of Date Palms

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Khamr comes from these two trees: The date palm and the grapevine

chapter.ara-name: باب تَأْوِيلِ قَوْلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى { وَمِنْ ثَمَرَاتِ النَّخِيلِ وَالأَعْنَابِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا }
chapter.eng-name: Interpretation of the Saying of Allah the Most High: "And From the Fruits of Date Palms

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Al-Mughirah that Ibrahim and Al-Sha'bi said:"Strong drink is Khamr

chapter.ara-name: باب تَأْوِيلِ قَوْلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى { وَمِنْ ثَمَرَاتِ النَّخِيلِ وَالأَعْنَابِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا }
chapter.eng-name: Interpretation of the Saying of Allah the Most High: "And From the Fruits of Date Palms

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Sa'eed bin Jubair said:"Strong drink is Khamr

chapter.ara-name: باب تَأْوِيلِ قَوْلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى { وَمِنْ ثَمَرَاتِ النَّخِيلِ وَالأَعْنَابِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا }
chapter.eng-name: Interpretation of the Saying of Allah the Most High: "And From the Fruits of Date Palms

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Sa'eed bin Jubair said:"Strong drink is Khamr

chapter.ara-name: باب تَأْوِيلِ قَوْلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى { وَمِنْ ثَمَرَاتِ النَّخِيلِ وَالأَعْنَابِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا }
chapter.eng-name: Interpretation of the Saying of Allah the Most High: "And From the Fruits of Date Palms

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Sa'eed bin Jubair said:"Strong drink is unlawful, and a 'goodly provision' (is lawful)

chapter.ara-name: باب تَأْوِيلِ قَوْلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى { وَمِنْ ثَمَرَاتِ النَّخِيلِ وَالأَعْنَابِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا }
chapter.eng-name: Interpretation of the Saying of Allah the Most High: "And From the Fruits of Date Palms

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:"I heard 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, delivering a Khutbah on the Minbar of Al-Madinah and he said: 'O people, on the day that the prohibition of Khamr was revealed, it was made from five things: From grapes, dates, honey, wheat and barley. Khamr is that which overcomes the mind

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ أَنْوَاعِ الأَشْيَاءِ الَّتِي كَانَتْ مِنْهَا الْخَمْرُ حِينَ نَزَلَ تَحْرِيمُهَا
chapter.eng-name: Kinds of Things From Which Khamr was Made When the Prohibition of it was Revealed

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:"I heard 'Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, on the Minbar of the Messenger of Allah [SAW], say: 'The prohibition of Khamr was revealed when it was made from five things: From grapes, wheat, barley, dates and honey

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ أَنْوَاعِ الأَشْيَاءِ الَّتِي كَانَتْ مِنْهَا الْخَمْرُ حِينَ نَزَلَ تَحْرِيمُهَا
chapter.eng-name: Kinds of Things From Which Khamr was Made When the Prohibition of it was Revealed

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:"Khamr is made from five things: From dates, wheat, barley, honey and grapes

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ أَنْوَاعِ الأَشْيَاءِ الَّتِي كَانَتْ مِنْهَا الْخَمْرُ حِينَ نَزَلَ تَحْرِيمُهَا
chapter.eng-name: Kinds of Things From Which Khamr was Made When the Prohibition of it was Revealed

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn Sirin said:"A man came to Ibn 'Umar and said: 'Our families make drinks for us by soaking (fruits) at night, and in the morning we drink them.' He said: 'I forbid you to drink intoxicants whether in small amounts or large. May Allah bear witness that I forbid you to drink intoxicants whether in small amounts or large. May Allah bear witness that the people of Khaibar used to make drinks by soaking such and such, and they called it such and such but it was Khamr. The people of Fadak used to make drinks by soaking such and such, and they called it such and such but it was Khamr.' And he listed four things, one of which was honey

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ الأَشْرِبَةِ الْمُسْكِرَةِ مِنَ الأَثْمَارِ وَالْحُبُوبِ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Intoxicating Drinks Made From Fruit and Grains of All Types

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:The Prophet [SAW] said: "Every intoxicant is unlawful and every intoxicant is Khamr

chapter.ara-name: باب إِثْبَاتِ اسْمِ الْخَمْرِ لِكُلِّ مُسْكِرٍ مِنَ الأَشْرِبَةِ
chapter.eng-name: Applying the Name Khamr to All Drinks that Intoxicate

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Every intoxicant is unlawful and every intoxicant is Khamr

chapter.ara-name: باب إِثْبَاتِ اسْمِ الْخَمْرِ لِكُلِّ مُسْكِرٍ مِنَ الأَشْرِبَةِ
chapter.eng-name: Applying the Name Khamr to All Drinks that Intoxicate

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Every intoxicant is Khamr

chapter.ara-name: باب إِثْبَاتِ اسْمِ الْخَمْرِ لِكُلِّ مُسْكِرٍ مِنَ الأَشْرِبَةِ
chapter.eng-name: Applying the Name Khamr to All Drinks that Intoxicate

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Every intoxicant is Khamr and every intoxicant is unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب إِثْبَاتِ اسْمِ الْخَمْرِ لِكُلِّ مُسْكِرٍ مِنَ الأَشْرِبَةِ

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Abu Burdah that his father said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] sent Mu'adh and me to Yemen. Mu'adh said: 'You are sending us to a land where the people have many kinds of drinks. What should I drink?' He said: 'Drink, but do not drink any intoxicant

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ

chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates

hadiths.text: Al-Aswad bin Shaiban As-Sadusi said:"I heard 'Ata' being asked by a man: 'We travel and drinks are offered to us in the marketplaces, and we do not know what kind of vessels they were prepared in.' He said: 'Every intoxicant is unlawful.' He repeated the question and he said: 'Every intoxicant is unlawful.' He repeated the question and he said: 'It is as I have told you

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates

chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates

hadiths.text: It was narrated that 'Abdul-Malik bin At-Tufail Al-Jazari said:"Umar bin 'Abdul-Aziz wrote to us, saying: 'Do not drink the thickened juice of grapes (obtained by boiling it down) until two-third of it has gone and one-third is left. And every intoxicant is unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates

hadiths.text: It was narrated that As-Sa'q bin Hazn said:"Umar bin 'Abdul-'Aziz wrote to 'Adiy bin Artah (saying): 'Every intoxicant is unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari that:The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Every intoxicant is unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates

hadiths.text: Abu Bakr bin Abi Musa narrated that his father said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] sent me to Yemen and I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, there are (different kinds of) drinks there, what should I drink, and what should I refrain from?' He said: 'What are they?' I said: 'Al-Bit' (mead) and Al-Mizr (beer).' He said: 'What are mead and beer?' I said: 'Mead is a drink made from honey and beer is a drink made from grains.' The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Do not drink any intoxicant, for I have forbidden all intoxicants

chapter.ara-name: باب تَفْسِيرِ الْبِتْعِ وَالْمِزْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Explanation of Al-Bit' (Mead) and Al-Mizr (Beer)

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Abu Burdah that his father said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] sent me to Yemen and I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, there are drinks there which they call Al-Bit' (mead) and Al-Mizr (beer).' He said: 'What is mead (and beer)?' I said: 'A drink made from honey, and beer is made from barley.' He said: 'Every intoxicant is unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب تَفْسِيرِ الْبِتْعِ وَالْمِزْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Explanation of Al-Bit' (Mead) and Al-Mizr (Beer)

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] delivered a Khutbah and quoted the Verse about Khamr. A man said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what do you think about Al-Mizr (beer)?' He said: 'What is beer?' He said: 'A (drink) from grains that is made in Yemen.' He said: 'Does it intoxicate?' He said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Every intoxicant is unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب تَفْسِيرِ الْبِتْعِ وَالْمِزْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Explanation of Al-Bit' (Mead) and Al-Mizr (Beer)

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Al-Juwairiyah said:"I heard Ibn 'Abbas when he was asked: 'Advise us about Badhiq (a drink made from the juice of grapes slightly boiled).' He said: 'Muhammad came before Badhiq (i.e., it was not known during his time), but everything that intoxicates is unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب تَفْسِيرِ الْبِتْعِ وَالْمِزْرِ
chapter.eng-name: Explanation of Al-Bit' (Mead) and Al-Mizr (Beer)

hadiths.text: Amr bin Shu'aib narrated from his father, from his grandfather, that:The Prophet [SAW] said: "What intoxicates in large amounts, a small amount of it is unlawful

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ كَثِيرُهُ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates in Large Amounts

hadiths.text: It was narrated from 'Amir bin Sa'd, from his father, that:The Prophet [SAW] said: "I forbid to you small amounts of whatever intoxicates in large amounts

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ كَثِيرُهُ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates in Large Amounts

hadiths.text: It was narrated from 'Amir bin Sa'd, from his father, that:The Prophet [SAW] forbade a small amount of whatever intoxicates in large amounts

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ كَثِيرُهُ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates in Large Amounts

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:"I know that the Messenger of Allah [SAW] was fasting, so I prepared some Nabidh for him to break his fast that I had prepared for him in a gourd. I brought it to him and he said: 'Bring it here.' So I brought it closer and it was bubbling. He said: 'Throw it against the wall (throw it away), for this is the drink of one who does not believe in Allah or the Last Day

chapter.ara-name: باب تَحْرِيمِ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ كَثِيرُهُ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Every Drink that Intoxicates in Large Amounts

hadiths.text: It was narrated that 'Ali - may Allah honor his face - said:"The Prophet [SAW] forbade to me to use gold rings, Al-Qassi, Al-Mitharah and Al-Ji'ah (a barley drink)

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجِعَةِ، وَهُوَ شَرَابٌ يُتَّخَذُ مِنَ الشَّعِيرِ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Al-Ji'ah Which is a Drink Made From Barley

hadiths.text: Sa'sa'ah said to 'Ali bin Abi Talib - may Allah honor his face - :"Forbid to us, O Commander of the Believers! What the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade to you." He said: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from using Ad-Dubba' and Al-Hantam

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجِعَةِ، وَهُوَ شَرَابٌ يُتَّخَذُ مِنَ الشَّعِيرِ
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Al-Ji'ah Which is a Drink Made From Barley

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Jabir that :(fruits) would be soaked for the Prophet [SAW] in a small vessel made of stone

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ مَا كَانَ يُنْبَذُ لِلنَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فِيهِ
chapter.eng-name: In What (Fruits) Were Soaked for the Prophet (ﷺ) [ﷺ]

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Tawus said:"A man said to Ibn 'Umar: 'Did the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid soaking (fruits) in earthenware jars?' He said: 'Yes.' Tawus said: 'By Allah, I heard that from him

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجَرِّ، مُفْرَدًا
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Soaking (Making Nabidh) in Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Sulaiman At-Taimi and Ibrahim bin Maisarah said:"We heard Tawus say: 'A man came to Ibn 'Umar and said: Did the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid soaking (fruits) in earthenware jars? He said: 'Yes.' Ibrahim added in his Hadith: "And Ad-Dubba' (gourds)

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجَرِّ، مُفْرَدًا
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Soaking (Making Nabidh) in Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: Ibn 'Abbas said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade soaking (fruits) in earthenware jars

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجَرِّ، مُفْرَدًا
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Soaking (Making Nabidh) in Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Al-Hantam. I (the narrator) said: "What is Al-Hantam?" He said: "The earthenware jar

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجَرِّ، مُفْرَدًا
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Soaking (Making Nabidh) in Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Maslamah said:"I heard 'Abdul-'Aziz - that is, bin Asid At-Tahi from Al-Basrah - say: 'Ibn Az-Zubair was asked about soaking (fruits) in earthenware jars and he said: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade us from that

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجَرِّ، مُفْرَدًا
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Soaking (Making Nabidh) in Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Sa'eed bin Jubair said:"We asked Ibn 'Umar about Nabidh made in an earthenware jar and he said: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade that.' So I went to Ibn 'Abbas and said to him: 'Today I heard something that surprised me.' He said: 'What was it?' I said: 'I asked Ibn 'Umar about Nabidh made in an earthenware jar and he said: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade it.' He said: 'Ibn 'Umar spoke the truth.' I said: 'What is an earthenware jar?' He said: 'Anything that is made of clay

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجَرِّ، مُفْرَدًا
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Soaking (Making Nabidh) in Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Sa'eed bin Jubair said:"I was with Ibn 'Umar when he was asked about Nabidh made in an earthenware jar. He said: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade it.' I got upset when I heard that, so I went to Ibn 'Abbas and said: 'Ibn 'Umar was asked about something, and I found it difficult.' He said: 'What was it?' I said: 'He was asked about Nabidh made in an earthenware jar.' He said: 'He spoke the truth; the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade it.' I said: 'What is an earthenware jar?' He said: 'Anything that is made of clay

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الْجَرِّ، مُفْرَدًا
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Soaking (Making Nabidh) in Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ash-Shaibani said:"I heard Ibn Abi Awfa say: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Nabidh made in green earthenware jars.' I said: 'And white ones?' He said: 'I do not know

chapter.ara-name: باب الْجَرِّ الأَخْضَرِ
chapter.eng-name: Green Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: Abu Ishaq Ash-Shaibani said:"I heard Ibn Abi Awfa say: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Nabidh made in green and white earthenware jars

chapter.ara-name: باب الْجَرِّ الأَخْضَرِ
chapter.eng-name: Green Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Raja' said:"I asked Al-Hasan about Nabidh made in earthenware jars - is it unlawful? He said: '(It is) unlawful. One who would not lie narrated to us that the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Nabidh made in Al-Hantam, Ad-Dubba' (gourds), Al-Muzaffat and An-Naqir

chapter.ara-name: باب الْجَرِّ الأَخْضَرِ
chapter.eng-name: Green Earthenware Jars

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba' (gourds)

chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds)

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba' (gourds)

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds)

hadiths.text: It was narrated that 'Aishah said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba' (gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْمُزَفَّتِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: It was narrated from 'Ali - may Allah honor his face - that:The Prophet [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba' (gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْمُزَفَّتِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: It was narrated from 'Abdur-Rahman bin Ya'mar that:The Prophet [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba' and Al-Muzaffat

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْمُزَفَّتِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Anas bin Malik that:The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade soaking (fruits) in Ad-Dubba' (gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْمُزَفَّتِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade soaking (fruits) in Ad-Dubba' (gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْمُزَفَّتِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that :The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Al-Muzaffat and squashes

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْمُزَفَّتِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds) and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that :The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba' (gourds), Al-Hantam and An-Naqir

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْحَنْتَمِ، وَالنَّقِيرِ،
chapter.eng-name: Mentioning the Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds), Al-Hantam and An-Naqir

hadiths.text: It was narrated that Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri said:The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade drinking from green pitchers, gourds and vessels carved from wood

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْحَنْتَمِ، وَالنَّقِيرِ،
chapter.eng-name: Mentioning the Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds), Al-Hantam and An-Naqir

chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds), Al-Hantam and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade earthenware jars, Ad-Dubba' (gourds), Al-Muzaffat containers

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْحَنْتَمِ، وَالْمُزَفَّتِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds), Al-Hantam and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: Aishah said:"I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbidding drinks made in Dubba' (gourds), Hantam or Muzaffat, that were not oil or vinegar

chapter.ara-name: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالْحَنْتَمِ، وَالْمُزَفَّتِ،
chapter.eng-name: Prohibition of Nabidh Made in Ad-Dubba' (Gourds), Al-Hantam and Al-Muzaffat

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah said:"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba' (gourds), Al-Hantam, An-Naqir, and Al-Muzaffat

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ النَّهْىِ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الدُّبَّاءِ، وَالنَّقِيرِ، وَالْمُقَيَّرِ، وَالْحَنْتَمِ،
